item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: Marijuana Legalization and the Presidential Election
item.description:
Marijuana Legalization and the Presidential Election

Even before getting to the issue of marijuana policy, let me say the current presidential campaign is unprecedented in many ways, few of which are positive. The Trump Factor The current campaign on the Republican side, which has been dominated by Donald Trump, has been the most incredible spectacle of the several presidential campaigns of my lifetime.

item.title: Obama announces new moves to fight drug abuse
item.description:
Obama announces new moves to fight drug abuse

It's part of a package of new initiatives announced Tuesday that includes other efforts to expand addiction treatment and increase coverage for mental health and substance abuse services. These initiatives are in addition to the $1.1 billion he proposed last month.

item.title: How The NFL Hides Its Painkiller Problem - The Cauldron
item.description:
How The NFL Hides Its Painkiller Problem - The Cauldron

Martavis Bryant knows he has to break out of this pattern of self-destructive behavior. And Josh Gordon is the first to admit he can be his own worst enemy. Marijuana and alcohol offenses have already cost these two hyper-talented NFL receivers dearly.

item.title: Anti-Addiction Drug May Help Curb Painkiller, Heroin Dependence
item.description:
Anti-Addiction Drug May Help Curb Painkiller, Heroin Dependence

Study finds lower relapse rate associated with naltrexone, but long-term use recommended

item.title: Weed Rosin Is Changing the Way We Get High
item.description:
Weed Rosin Is Changing the Way We Get High

In a converted gas station by an enormous stone Buddha in Mendocino County, Calif., Tim Blake stands in front of a mound of cannabis "trichomes." These crystalline hairs, collected from dried marijuana buds, are rich in THC, the psychoactive ingredient in cannabis responsible for getting a person high.

item.title: Longtime marijuana use might make you a loser
item.description:
Longtime marijuana use might make you a loser

There's a new report out on longtime marijuana use. And it's bad news for habitual stoners. In summary: The more pot you smoke, the more apt you are to be a loser. And it's not so much that losers toke weed. It's that toking a lot of weed over several years turns someone into a loser.

item.title: How the Myth of the "Addicted" Baby Hurts Newborns and Moms
item.description:
How the Myth of the "Addicted" Baby Hurts Newborns and Moms

March 24th, 2016 Thirty-five-year-old Barbara Galarza found out about her pregnancy seven-and-a-half months into it, when she attempted to check into a detox facility in New Jersey in 2003. A urine screen showed she was pregnant, forcing Barbara out the door. That facility, like most other drug tre
